segments.text: Hey Kevin , what are you doing here ? Don't you usually spend Tuesday nights at home studying ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I needed to get out of the house . My parents just went ballistic over something my older sister told them .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What did she tell them ? Is she dropping out of college ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Nothing that serious . She finally told them that she moved out of the dormitory a few months ago and has been living with her boyfriend .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And your parents took it badly ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's putting it mildly . My father started shouting at my sister and my mother just glared at her .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Ouch , that sounds bad . What did your sister do ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She started arguing back to my dad that how much she loves her boyfriend , how they're in love and it's not hurting anybody , and so on . My dad said she's too young to do this , and that she should move out right away .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How long has your sister been with her boyfriend ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Three years . They've been dating since freshman year . They're even talking about marriage .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Really ? Then I guess living together would be a good idea .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , these days too many people are getting divorced . If they live together , then at least they're finding out if they're really compatible or not .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I guess so . Better to find out now than after you're married , when it's harder to get out .
segments.speaker: S2
